Need tracking system.", "toolContext": "Setting up daily habit routines", "primaryGoal": "Build sustainable daily routines", "subgoal": "Create habit definitions and tracking"}, "filePath": "Habits/daily_routines.md", "oldContent": "", "newContent": "Daily Habits - Established Nov 9

Habit 1: Morning Meditation (6:30-6:45am)
Trigger: Alarm
Routine: Sit, focus on breath, observe thoughts
Reward: Sense of calm
Tracking: Daily checkbox

Habit 2: Daily Writing (7:00-7:30am)
Trigger: Coffee ready
Routine: Write 500 words on project/reflection
Reward: Progress feeling
Tracking: Word count

Habit 3: Exercise (12:00-1:00pm)
Trigger: Lunch time
Routine: 30 min run/strength + 30 min cool down
Reward: Energy boost
Tracking: Workout log

Habit 4: Reading (9:00-9:30pm)
Trigger: End of work day
Routine: Read 20-30 pages
Reward: Knowledge, relaxation
Tracking: Books completed

Weekly Review: Sundays 7pm - Assess completion, adjust if needed"}

Excellent! Your daily habits system is established and ready. 4 core habits strategically scheduled: meditation (6:30am), writing (7:00am), exercise (12:00pm), reading (9:00pm). Each has clear triggers, routines, rewards, and tracking. The habit loop structure (Trigger → Routine → Reward → Track) removes friction and builds momentum. Weekly reviews on Sundays keep you accountable. This is sustainable and not overwhelming. Ready to launch habit tracking Nov 10 and build consistency?
